item.title: Missouri Journalists: How to Access the State Prison System’s Comprehensive Death Data
item.description: The Missouri Department of Corrections generated its first report with every prison death in its system. Here’s how to use it.

item.title: How a Public Record Cost Cuyahoga County Taxpayers $650,000
item.description: A worker’s demotion after releasing court records to The Marshall Project - Cleveland led to a lawsuit alleging retaliation and witness intimidation.

item.title: Nurses Say Staff Shortage at Missouri Prison Means Skipped Medication, Long Waits for Care
item.description: Current and former employees at Jefferson City Correctional Center say the shortage is causing unrest. They blame the state’s contractor, Centurion He...

item.title: Starve and Charge: Aramark Cut Free Prison Meals to Boost Profits, New Suit Claims
item.description: A lawsuit claims the prison food company is cutting institutional meals to force incarcerated people to purchase costly food from the same vendor.

item.title: Federal Agents Pepper Spray Protesters During Tucson Taco Shop Raid
item.description: See video from the scene as ICE officers attempted to disperse a crowd in the street outside the taqueria.
